title: US diplomat’s wife suspected of killing teen in hit and run flees UK
text:
Harry Dunn, 19, was riding his motorbike when he was hit by someone driving on the wrong side of the road (Picture: Justice4Harry)

The wife of a US diplomat suspected of being involved in a fatal hit-and-run has claimed immunity and fled the country, it has emerged.

Harry Dunn, 19, died after his motorbike was hit by a car being driven on the wrong side of the road in Northamptonshire.

The unnamed suspect is the wife of a US envoy who has now left the UK, leaving the teen’s family fearing they will never get justice.

Mr Dunn’s mother, Charlotte Charles, has now issued a direct appeal to US President Donald Trump for help.

She said to Sky News: ‘President Trump, please listen. We’re a family in ruin. We’re broken.

‘We can’t grieve. Please, please let her get back on a plane.’

Harry Dunn, 19, died after an accident near RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire on 27 August (Picture: Justice4Harry)

The head-on crash happened near a US spy base at RAF Croughton on August 27.

Mr Dunn was left with multiple injuries and later died in hospital.

His mum added: ‘Everyone loved him, we’re utterly broken inside and out.

‘Everything hurts day and night, it’s an effort to do anything. I ache from it, every limb, every internal organ hurts.

‘We don’t know how we can start to grieve for him. We have nothing. No justice.

‘We have nothing to put our minds at rest that she’s even remorseful.’

Harry’s mother Charlotte has issued an appeal to Donald Trump to get justice for her son (Picture: Sky News)

Following their son’s death, Mr Dunn’s parents received a letter from Woody Johnson, US Ambassador to the UK, expressing ‘profound sadness’.

But efforts to contact the American suspect have been met with silence.

Diplomatic immunity allows unhindered travel for Government envoys and their families.

An attempt by Northamptonshire Police to stop the suspect leaving was declined.

The US Embassy has confirmed she is no longer in the UK.

Mr Dunn’s father Tim said: ‘We’re disgusted, appalled. How could she be having this cloak wrapped around her?

‘I’m angry someone could do this then get on a plane and go. I can’t believe she’s living with herself.’

Woody Johnson has expressed ‘profound sadness’ (Picture: PA)

UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said he has spoken to the US Ambassador about the situation.

He said: ‘I wish to offer my condolences to the family affected by this tragic incident.

‘I have called the US Ambassador to express the UK’s disappointment with their decision, and to urge the embassy to reconsider it.’

A campaign group called Justice For Harry has been set up on social media, aiming to raise £10,000 though a gofundme page.

Harry Dunn was riding his bike when he was hit by a driver (Picture: Facebook)

The US embassy in London said: ‘We express our deepest sympathies and offer condolences to the family of the deceased in the tragic August 27 traffic accident involving a vehicle driven by the spouse of a US diplomat assigned to the United Kingdom.

‘Embassy officials are in close contact with the appropriate British officials on this matter.

‘Due to security and privacy considerations, we cannot confirm the identity of the individuals involved, but we can confirm the family has left the UK.’
description: Donald Trump has been urged to intervene by Harry Dunn's heartbroken parents.
